name: UBX-CFG-PRT
description: Port configuration for UART ports. This message is deprecated in protocol versions greater than 23.01. Use UBX-CFG-VALSET, UBX-CFG-VALGET, UBX-CFG-VALDEL instead.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number (see Integration manual for valid UART port IDs)

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: TX ready PIN configuration (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01). Bit 0: 'en' (Enable TX ready feature for this port); Bit 1: 'pol' (Polarity: 0=High-active, 1=Low-active); Bits 6-2: 'pin' (PIO to be used, must not be in use by another function); Bits 15-7: 'thres' (Threshold, multiplied by 8 bytes. Examples: 0x000=no threshold, 0x001=8byte, 0x002=16byte, ..., 0x1FE=4080byte, 0x1FF=4088byte).

fields.name: mode
fields.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode. Bits 7-6: 'charLen' (Character length: 00=5bit (not supported), 01=6bit (not supported), 10=7bit (supported only with parity), 11=8bit); Bits 11-9: 'parity' (000=Even parity, 001=Odd parity, 10X=No parity, X1X=Reserved); Bits 13-12: 'nStopBits' (Number of Stop bits: 00=1 Stop bit, 01=1.5 Stop bit, 10=2 Stop bit, 11=0.5 Stop bit).

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Bit 0: 'inUbx' (UBX protocol); Bit 1: 'inNmea' (NMEA protocol); Bit 2: 'inRtcm' (RTCM2 protocol); Bit 5: 'inRtcm3' (RTCM3 protocol, not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00).

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Bit 0: 'outUbx' (UBX protocol); Bit 1: 'outNmea' (NMEA protocol); Bit 5: 'outRtcm3' (RTCM3 protocol, not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00).

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask. Bit 1: 'extendedTxTimeout' (If set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. If not set, the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless of the amount of allocated TX memory. Not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01).
